title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-4.7 - Interim certification
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-4.7 - Interim certification

State Regulations

In addition to the orientation seminar and the ethics
component, a county director must satisfy two or more components of the basic
course of training during the first year after appointment, or five or more
components in any two consecutive years after appointment in order to receive
an interim certification in each year. In no event shall an interim certificate
remain in effect for more than one year after its date of issuance or more than
four years after the county director's date of appointment. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8188-4.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
